TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content: Downloaded ISA Mapsat and started mapping Kerbin. Onto the Mun next.....
found out my new station dissapeared...cried

Flew to the North Pole, crash landed, planted a flag.

Sent a rescue mission in the form of a base and crashed that too.

Oh well, at least I got the Cupola the right way up, now to scavenge the parts to keep warm, it's cold up there...

Killed some kerbals developing new series of unflippable rovers with the new wheels. The new 4.8 ton nuclear powered armored monster it so stable that it can drive on two wheels even on Kerbin, intentionally tumble at top speed, and flip itself back w/o any damage.
Transfered my Heavy Launch Vehicle design from .19 to .2. I'm not giving up what took a considerable amount of time to make perfect for just about anything I need to put into orbit.

Sent Malsey II and Shepdan to Dres as the first Kerbals to ever set foot upon it. Despite their ship being woefully underfuelled, thanks to their brilliant piloting skills they successfully managed to crash into land on the Dresian surface. With 30% of the lander missing by the time it stopped rolling down the hillside, it was hardly a textbook landing, but by god it was a landing. Considering the lander had to perform most of the capture manoeuvre and attempt the landing with barely any fuel remaining, I'd say they did rather well.
My big projects are frustrating me, so I took a break to see if I could land a plane on each of the unimproved islands southeast of KSC.

I propose a moment of silence for this man right here. He deserves all of our respect for his heroic actions today.

(Insert silence here)
Landed on Bop and planted a flag on the dead kraken's frustrating body.
Set up a Remotetech satellite network for Kerbin. Simply four relays in 250km orbits that communicate with a hub relay in Geosynchronous orbit!
Set up my first space station KSS Alpha well it was my first try but its already usable for eight astronauts four of them are already in station
Started assembling Mir from the soviet pack using hyperedit and ORDA, I have the core module and both Kvants as of 4:56 CST.
I landed my new Lander on Gilly:

I finished designing my single-jet SSTO. The K-21 Munray.

Successfully I might add. Runway to Minmus without stopping for gas.
Today, Dersen Kerman embarked on a one-way mission to Eeloo. You will be remembered, brave hero.
I recreated my forum account and I'm posting so fast the forum server thinks I'm a spambot!

School, Solved 225 Rubiks cubes (fingers hurt like crazy right now), came home and launched Bill to the Mun with a rover. Sadly, Bill has been a notoriously bad driver, and the mission was lost after he drove into the command pod at high speeds...

I did this:

This:

And finally this:

I'll leave it up to you all to figure out the story behind it.

...I'll leave it up to you all to figure out the story behind it.

Based on the first pic I'd say apple said you can't customise your desktop.

Based on the first pic I'd say apple said you can't customise your desktop.

Nope. Check the Petition thread in off topic.
Today I built and tested my Adromache 1 "Big Boy" on minmus, testing for its journey to where ever I feel is cool at the moment.

I did an orion mod test flight and sent a science probe to Eve that got data while it entered the atmosphere

20 gs durimg entry!

Tried to get my heavy lifter to work.

Needs more struts...
Started on my new Laythe base that's sitting on top of 200K of kethane.

Today - or well, it was last night, but past midnight, so that qualifies - I finally managed to build a vessel to rescue Jeb from his stand-by orbit and bring him down back to Kerbin safely. It took me a few iterations, until i had a nice, compact lifter with a small orbital stage that could rendezvous with Jeb's Munar lander.

The lander had worked like a charm, though sadly it had a small design flaw, namely I forgot parachutes. I was surprised it had enough fuel for a trip there and back though, but in the end, I'm happy to have managed to pick him up and return him to safety rather than just abusing end flight. I did do so for the empty lander though, since for lack of probe core, I couldn't properly de-orbit it.
